Customer Obsession.primary: How well do you feel your team prioritizes customer needs in your daily work?
followups: To what extent do you feel customer feedback is actively integrated into your projects? (1 = Not at All, 5 = Completely)

Customer Obsession.primary: How often do you think about the long-term impact on customers when making decisions?
followups: How confident are you that your decisions positively impact customer satisfaction? (1 = Not Confident, 5 = Very Confident)

Customer Obsession.primary: Do you believe your team is consistently focused on improving the customer experience?
followups: How often do you receive actionable insights from customer feedback? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Customer Obsession.primary: How often do you consider customer pain points when developing new features or services?
followups: How effective is your team at addressing these pain points? (1 = Not Effective, 5 = Very Effective)

Customer Obsession.primary: How aligned do you feel your work is with Amazon’s goal of customer obsession?
followups: How much support do you receive to focus on customer-centric projects? (1 = No Support, 5 = Full Support)

Ownership.primary: How responsible do you feel for the success or failure of your projects?
followups: How often do you take ownership beyond your immediate responsibilities? (1 = Never, 5 = Always)

Ownership.primary: How empowered do you feel to make decisions that affect your work?
followups: How much autonomy do you have in your role? (1 = No Autonomy, 5 = Complete Autonomy)

Ownership.primary: Do you feel a strong sense of ownership over your work outcomes?
followups: How often do you go the extra mile to ensure project success? (1 = Never, 5 = Always)

Ownership.primary: How often do you proactively address issues or challenges in your work?
followups: How confident are you that your proactive efforts are recognized? (1 = Not Confident, 5 = Very Confident)

Ownership.primary: Do you feel that ownership is equally distributed within your team?
followups: How effective is your team at supporting individual ownership? (1 = Not Effective, 5 = Very Effective)

Invent and Simplify.primary: How often do you bring new ideas to simplify processes or solve problems?
followups: How likely are your ideas to be implemented? (1 = Not Likely, 5 = Very Likely)

Invent and Simplify.primary: How often does your team prioritize simplicity in developing new solutions?
followups: How effective are these simplifications in improving efficiency? (1 = Not Effective, 5 = Very Effective)

Invent and Simplify.primary: How comfortable are you with taking risks to innovate?
followups: How much support do you receive from leadership to innovate? (1 = No Support, 5 = Full Support)

Invent and Simplify.primary: Do you believe your team continuously strives for innovation?
followups: How often do you see these innovations positively impacting your work? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Invent and Simplify.primary: How often do you challenge the status quo in your work?
followups: How open is your team to embracing new ideas? (1 = Not Open, 5 = Very Open)

Are Right, A Lot.primary: How often do you feel confident in your decisions at work?
followups: How often are your decisions validated by positive outcomes? (1 = Never, 5 = Always)

Are Right, A Lot.primary: How well do you balance intuition and data when making decisions?
followups: How often do your data-driven decisions lead to the desired results? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Are Right, A Lot.primary: How frequently do you revisit and adjust your decisions based on new information?
followups: How effective are these adjustments in improving outcomes? (1 = Not Effective, 5 = Very Effective)

Are Right, A Lot.primary: Do you feel comfortable questioning decisions when you believe there is a better approach?
followups: How often do your suggestions lead to changes in strategy? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Are Right, A Lot.primary: How often do you seek diverse perspectives before making a decision?
followups: How often do these perspectives improve the quality of your decisions? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Learn and Be Curious.primary: How often do you seek out new learning opportunities?
followups: How satisfied are you with the learning resources available to you? (1 = Not Satisfied, 5 = Very Satisfied)

Learn and Be Curious.primary: How much do you focus on learning about areas outside your expertise?
followups: How often does this broadened knowledge benefit your work? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Learn and Be Curious.primary: How often do you ask questions to deepen your understanding of a topic?
followups: How effective are your inquiries in expanding your knowledge? (1 = Not Effective, 5 = Very Effective)

Learn and Be Curious.primary: How often do you share what you’ve learned with your team?
followups: How valuable do you think this shared knowledge is to your team? (1 = Not Valuable, 5 = Very Valuable)

Learn and Be Curious.primary: How comfortable are you with exploring new and unfamiliar topics?
followups: How often does this exploration lead to innovation or improvement? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Hire and Develop the Best.primary: How confident are you in the quality of the hires in your team?
followups: How often do new hires meet or exceed your expectations? (1 = Never, 5 = Always)

Hire and Develop the Best.primary: How actively do you engage in mentoring or developing others?
followups: How effective do you believe your mentoring efforts are? (1 = Not Effective, 5 = Very Effective)

Hire and Develop the Best.primary: How well do you think your team attracts top talent?
followups: How satisfied are you with the recruiting processes? (1 = Not Satisfied, 5 = Very Satisfied)

Hire and Develop the Best.primary: How much do you feel the team invests in your development?
followups: How often do these development efforts improve your performance? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Hire and Develop the Best.primary: How often do you receive feedback that helps you grow?
followups: How useful do you find the feedback provided to you? (1 = Not Useful, 5 = Very Useful)

Insist on the Highest Standards.primary: How often do you ensure your work meets the highest standards?
followups: How confident are you that your work consistently meets these standards? (1 = Not Confident, 5 = Very Confident)

Insist on the Highest Standards.primary: How often do you challenge the quality of work in your team?
followups: How receptive is your team to feedback aimed at raising standards? (1 = Not Receptive, 5 = Very Receptive)

Insist on the Highest Standards.primary: How often do you revisit your work to ensure it meets high standards?
followups: How much support do you receive to maintain these standards? (1 = No Support, 5 = Full Support)

Insist on the Highest Standards.primary: How well do you think your team balances speed with quality?
followups: How often do you think compromises are made that affect quality? (1 = Often, 5 = Never)

Insist on the Highest Standards.primary: How comfortable are you with holding others accountable to high standards?
followups: How often do you see positive changes when holding others accountable? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Think Big.primary: How often do you push boundaries to think beyond the immediate scope of your work?
followups: How often do these ideas lead to new opportunities or projects? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Think Big.primary: How well do you believe your team encourages ambitious goals?
followups: How often do you see support for executing on big ideas? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Think Big.primary: How comfortable are you with proposing bold ideas?
followups: How often are your big ideas taken seriously by your team? (1 = Never, 5 = Always)

Think Big.primary: How much do you focus on long-term goals versus short-term tasks?
followups: How aligned do you feel your long-term goals are with the company’s vision? (1 = Not Aligned, 5 = Fully Aligned)

Think Big.primary: How often do you think about how your work impacts the company at a broader level?
followups: How often does your team discuss the broader impact of their work? (1 = Never, 5 = Always)

Bias for Action.primary: How often do you take swift action when faced with a challenge?
followups: How confident are you in your ability to make quick decisions? (1 = Not Confident, 5 = Very Confident)

Bias for Action.primary: How well does your team balance speed with thoroughness?
followups: How often do quick actions lead to positive outcomes? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Bias for Action.primary: How often do you prioritize taking action over waiting for more information?
followups: How often do these actions result in successful outcomes? (1 = Never, 5 = Always)

Bias for Action.primary: How comfortable are you with making decisions under uncertainty?
followups: How often do these decisions lead to the desired results? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Bias for Action.primary: How often do you encourage your team to act quickly when opportunities arise?
followups: How often do quick actions by your team lead to innovation or improvement? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Frugality.primary: How often do you seek cost-effective solutions to challenges?
followups: How successful are these cost-effective solutions in meeting objectives? (1 = Not Successful, 5 = Very Successful)

Frugality.primary: How often do you find ways to do more with less in your work?
followups: How often does this frugality lead to increased efficiency? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Frugality.primary: How mindful are you of resource constraints when planning projects?
followups: How often do you meet project goals while staying within budget? (1 = Never, 5 = Always)

Frugality.primary: How often do you consider the financial impact of your decisions?
followups: How often do these considerations lead to cost savings? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Frugality.primary: How effectively do you prioritize spending on what matters most?
followups: How often do you achieve more with fewer resources? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Earn Trust.primary: How much trust do you feel exists between you and your team?
followups: How often do you feel your team members rely on you? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Earn Trust.primary: How often do you demonstrate transparency in your work?
followups: How effective do you believe transparency is in building trust? (1 = Not Effective, 5 = Very Effective)

Earn Trust.primary: How often do you admit mistakes when they occur?
followups: How much do you feel this honesty strengthens trust in your team? (1 = Not at All, 5 = Very Much)

Earn Trust.primary: How often do you seek to understand others’ perspectives before making a decision?
followups: How often do these efforts lead to better team dynamics? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Earn Trust.primary: How often do you follow through on commitments to your team?
followups: How much do you think this reliability contributes to the trust your team has in you? (1 = Not at All, 5 = Very Much)

Dive Deep.primary: How often do you dig deep into the details when solving problems?
followups: How effective do you find this deep dive in solving complex issues? (1 = Not Effective, 5 = Very Effective)

Dive Deep.primary: How often do you ask probing questions to understand the root cause of a problem?
followups: How often do these questions lead to better solutions? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Dive Deep.primary: How comfortable are you with challenging assumptions and exploring details?
followups: How often does this lead to uncovering important insights? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Dive Deep.primary: How often do you spend time understanding the details of your projects?
followups: How often do you believe this leads to successful project outcomes? (1 = Never, 5 = Always)

Dive Deep.primary: How well do you balance attention to detail with overall project goals?
followups: How often does this balance lead to successful project completion? (1 = Never, 5 = Always)

Have Backbone; Disagree and Commit.primary: How often do you voice your opinions even if they differ from others?
followups: How often do your differing opinions lead to meaningful discussions? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Have Backbone; Disagree and Commit.primary: How comfortable are you with standing your ground when you believe in something?
followups: How often do your convictions positively impact the final decision? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Have Backbone; Disagree and Commit.primary: How often do you challenge decisions that you believe are incorrect?
followups: How often does this lead to better outcomes? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Have Backbone; Disagree and Commit.primary: How willing are you to commit to a decision once it has been made, even if you disagreed?
followups: How often does this commitment contribute to team success? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Have Backbone; Disagree and Commit.primary: How often do you feel your disagreements are respected within your team?
followups: How often do these disagreements lead to constructive outcomes? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Deliver Results.primary: How consistently do you meet your performance targets?
followups: How confident are you that your efforts are aligned with company goals? (1 = Not Confident, 5 = Very Confident)

Deliver Results.primary: How well do you prioritize tasks to ensure timely delivery of results?
followups: How often do you complete tasks on or ahead of schedule? (1 = Never, 5 = Always)

Deliver Results.primary: How often do you measure your progress toward goals?
followups: How effective is this measurement in driving you toward successful outcomes? (1 = Not Effective, 5 = Very Effective)

Deliver Results.primary: How confident are you in your ability to overcome obstacles to deliver results?
followups: How often do you find creative solutions to meet or exceed targets? (1 = Never, 5 = Very Often)

Deliver Results.primary: How well do you balance delivering results with maintaining quality?
followups: How often do you achieve high-quality results within the given timeline? (1 = Never, 5 = Always)
